com.hippikon.security
Class AuthorizationContext

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.AuthorizationContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultAuthorizationContext
public abstract class AuthorizationContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The AuthorizationContext provides a placeholder for information retrieved after a user of a application has been authentication. Authentication is deferred to a different subsystem and is not provided as part of the Hippikon API. In fact, the details of authentication are completely decoupled and any authentication system can be used.

In order to hook into the Hippikon authorization framework, a post condition resulting in a sucessful authentication should be a valid AuthorizationContext object has been created, which can then be used to obtain a PermissionSet that govenrs access to a ProtectedResource.

The information within the context object must be passed to every authorization request in order to obtain the PermissionSet}. Subclasses should consider implementing their own persistance mechanism to avoid potentially expensive calls on each authorization request e.g., storing roles in an Cookie for web based systems.

The context object also provides a Check Point (ref: Yoder) for each user access attempt before any pemission checking is performed. If the accountID, userGUID or productID attributes are not available or deemed invalid, an IllegalAuthorizationException must be thrown.

Since:
JDK 1.2.2
Version:

public AuthorizationContext()
Method Detail

getProductID

public abstract java.lang.String getProductID()
Returns the identifier of the product being accessed by the user. The combination of the productID and the accountID is used to qualify roles that are product-specific.

Returns:
the identifier of the product being accessed

getAccountID

public abstract java.lang.String getAccountID()
Returns the identifier of the account the user belongs to.

Returns:
the identifer of the account the user belongs to

getUserGUID

public abstract java.lang.String getUserGUID()
Returns the unique identifer of the authenticated user accessing a ProtectedResource.

Returns:
the unique identifer of the user

getUserRoles

public abstract java.util.List getUserRoles()
Returns a List roles assigned to the authenticated user as Strings in the context of the product being accessed. Each product must defined at least one role that users may be assigned, plus application specific roles used by the business logic.

Returns:
the list of roles assigned to the user in the context of the product being accessed.

isAssignedToRole

public abstract boolean isAssignedToRole(java.lang.String role)
Determines if the user is assigned to the input role.

Parameters:
role - the role to be tested.
Returns:
true if the user is assigned to the role, false otherwise.

getSubscriptions

public abstract java.util.List getSubscriptions()
Returns a List of subscriptions available to the authenticated user as Strings.

Returns:
the list of subscriptions available to the user.

getLocale

public abstract java.util.Locale getLocale()
Gets the Locale to be used. If no locale was determined, returns null.

Returns:
the locale, or null if no locale specified.

getTimeZone

public abstract java.util.TimeZone getTimeZone()
Gets the TimeZone to be used. If no timezone was determined, returns the timeZone for GMT.

Returns:
the timeZone.

setUserPrincipals

protected abstract void setUserPrincipals(java.util.List principals)
Sets the list of user principals determined by the Policy callbacks for each ProtectedResource being accessed.

Parameters:
principals - a List of String objects representing the user principals determined by Policy classes mapped to ProtectedResource objects being accessed.

getUserGroups

public abstract java.util.List getUserGroups()
Returns a List groups assigned to the authenticated user as Strings in the context of the product being accessed.

Returns:
the list of groups assigned to the user in the context of the product being accessed.

getPrincipals

protected abstract java.util.List getPrincipals()
Returns the list of all principals of a user determined through a combination of user roles, groups and associations with the ProtectedResources being accessed.

This method is not made public because there is no guarentee when this value will be set by the authorization framework.

setResourcePath

protected abstract void setResourcePath(java.util.List resources)
Sets the list of ProtectedResource names being accessed within the AuthorizationContext. This method is provided to pass through the complete authorization context to policy implementations only.

It is not made public since the authorization framework does not guarentee when the resource path list will be set.

Parameters:
resources - a List of String objects representing the hierachy of ProtectedResource objects being accessed. The Strings match the ProtectedResource.getResourceName() return values.

getResourcePath

protected abstract java.util.List getResourcePath()
Returns the List of names of each ProtectedResource being accessed by the client.

Returns:
a List of String objects
